Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: Rock of [C]ages, [F/C]cleft for [C]me Let me[C] hide [F]myself i[C]n thee Let the wa[F]ter and the [C]blood From thy wou[F]nded side which [C]flowed Be of [C]sin the [F]double [C]cure Save from w[C]rath and m[G]ake me p[C]ure
Verse 2: Not the [C]labors [F]of my [C]hands Can [C]fulﬁll the [F]laws [C]commands Should my [F]passion never [C]fade And my [F]efforts all be [C]weighed All for [C]sin could [F]not [C]atone You must [C]save and [G]you [C]alone
Chorus: [C]Rock[C/B] of a[Am]ges [C] No one [F]takes your [C]life Yet you [F]died that I might [C]live Costly [F]grace you freely [Am]give Rock of ag[F]es [C] You have [Dm]paid the [Am]price You were [F]cleft to cover [C]me Let me [F]hide myself in [C]thee
{new_page} Verse 3: Nothing [C]in my [F]hand I [C]bring Simply [C]to the [F]cross I [C]cling Naked [F]come to thee for [C]dress Helpless [F]look to thee for [C]grace Wretched [C]to the [F]fount I [C]ﬂy Wash me [C]Savior [G]or I [C]die
Bridge: And w[Am]hile[C/B] I d[C]raw my [F]final [C]breath I'll [Am]res[C/B]t up[C]on your [G]grace And w[Am]hen[C/B] I c[C]lose my [F]eyes in [C]death I'll [Am]wake[C/B] to [C]see your [G]face
Interlude:
[Am] [C] [F] [C] [Am] [C] [G] [E7]
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 rock of ages cleft for me let me hide myself in thee let the water and the blood from thy wounded side which flowed be of sin the double cure save from wrath and make me pure verse 2 not the labors of my hands can fulﬁll the laws commands should my passion never fade and my efforts all be weighed all for sin could not atone you must save and you alone chorus rock of ages no one takes your life yet you died that i might live costly grace you freely give rock of ages you have paid the price you were cleft to cover me let me hide myself in thee verse 3 nothing in my hand i bring simply to the cross i cling naked come to thee for dress helpless look to thee for grace wretched to the fount i ﬂy wash me savior or i die bridge and while i draw my final breath ill rest upon your grace and when i close my eyes in death ill wake to see your face interlude
